data.text:
Johnny Wright Jr., 57, of 170 Legion Road, Summerville, departed this life on Sunday, December 20, 2015 at Trident Medical Center, Charleton. Services will be held 11:00AM Saturday, December 26th at The House of God Church, Ridgeville. The final resting place will be in Shuler Cemetery, Ridgeville.

Reverend Johnny Wright, Jr., was born July 5, 1958 in Ridgeville, South Carolina. The son of Bro. Johnny and Rev. Mattie Wright, Sr. On Sunday, December 20, 2015, the Lord called him home to be at Peace with his love ones who preceded him in death.

Reverend Johnny grew up in Berkeley County, South Carolina (Pringle Town) and attended the public schools there; Poplar Hill Elementary School and Cross High School (Class of 1977).

Reverend Johnny was a devoted family man and a hard worker. On July 31, 1993, he was united into holy matrimony to Tr. Deaconess Lucretia Gilliard Wright. To this union one child was born. He worked at Getrag for many years. He had a passion for music, known as the CD King. At any given time you would be blessed with an encouraging CD to listen to.

Reverend Johnny received the baptism of the Holy Ghost at an early age and joined The House of God Ridgeville, Keith Dominion. In August of 1999, he was called into the ministry under the leadership of the Late General Elder Irving Capers. Appointed as Pastor Helper in 2012 and served on numerous local and state auxiliaries. In 2014, Reverend Johnny was appointed Assistant Pastor of House of God Grover, (Grover, SC). For those who knew him know that he loved praising God through preaching and beating the bass drum. “I Owe God Praise”.

Preceding Reverend Johnny in death, his grandmother the late Elder Mary Anderson and mother in law Elizabeth Gilliard.

Reverend Johnny has left behind to cherish his fondest memories: his loving and devoted wife Tr. Deaconess Lucretia Gilliard Wright of the home; four loving children: LaToya Wright of Ladson; Evelyn Wright of Columbia; Candice Wright of Charleston and Johntrell Wright of the home; parent Bro. Johnny and Rev. Mattie Wright, Sr.; three sibling: Carin Coburn of Summerville; Pastor Edwin Wright of Goose Creek; and Kirkpatrick(Betty) Wright of Orangeburg; three grandchildren: Tatiuanna, Presence and King; one God daughter: Zion Boyd; father in law: Benjamin(Vanessa) Gethers of Cross; four sister in law: Katrina(Bernard) Pringle; Tamiko Gilliard, Shekemia Gilliard, Cynthia (Reggie) McFadden; five brothers in law: David(Michelle) Gilliard; DeaManco(Consondra) Gethers; Kendrick Gilliard; DeShawn Gethers; Tharren Gethers and Dontell Gillard. Two special aunts Janet G. Ramsey and Louise G. Bryant, a host of nieces, nephews, aunts, uncles, cousins, other relatives and a special friend of the family Mr. Joseph Neals.
